allow: Bash(# Check flake inputs to find the actual repo and then look at it nix flake metadata /home/erahhal/Code/nixcfg --json)

Bash(# Check how home-manager activation scripts work - they may use $run which is different # Look at the actual generated activation script grep -A30 ""dmsSettingsSync"" /nix/store/*-home-manager-generation/activate)
Bash(# Check the CommandRunner plugin to understand its config format ls -la ~/.config/DankMaterialShell/plugins/CommandRunner/ cat ~/.config/DankMaterialShell/plugins/CommandRunner/main.qml)
Bash(# Check the full activation order grep -E ""(entryAfter|linkGeneration|writeBoundary)"" /nix/store/3m16pfbk0hkc8p5nvfvihdjyqyrvpm6w-home-manager-generation/activate)
Bash(# Check what linkGeneration does and when it runs relative to writeBoundary grep -B5 -A50 ""linkGeneration"" /nix/store/3m16pfbk0hkc8p5nvfvihdjyqyrvpm6w-home-manager-generation/activate)
Bash(# Let me see the full activation script order - what comes before dmsSettingsSync cat /nix/store/3m16pfbk0hkc8p5nvfvihdjyqyrvpm6w-home-manager-generation/activate)
Bash(# Let''s look at the DMS module itself to understand how default.settings is converted to a file nix flake metadata /home/erahhal/Code/nixcfg --json)
Bash(# Look at the DMS module from the flake to understand plugin settings handling nix flake show github:AvengeMedia/DankMaterialShell)
Bash(# Search for how the dankMaterialShell module creates default-settings.json grep -r ""default-settings"" /home/erahhal/Code/nixcfg --include=""*.nix"")
Bash(# Test each part separately echo ""=== Tailscale status ==="" tailscale status 2>&1 echo ""tailscale exit: $?"" echo ""=== grep for wg0|tun0 ==="" ls /sys/class/net)
Bash(# Check if head -1 affects exit code echo ""=== Without head ==="" ls /sys/class/net)
Bash(# Test grep -m 1 (returns first match, preserves exit code) echo ""=== grep -m 1 with no match ==="" ls /sys/class/net)
Bash(# Check ls -1 output (one per line, names only) echo ""=== ls -1 /sys/class/net ==="" ls -1 /sys/class/net echo """" echo ""=== grep -m 1 with ls -1 ==="" ls -1 /sys/class/net)
Bash(# Test grep -o -m 1 (output only matched portion, first match only) echo ""=== grep -o -m 1 ==="" ls /sys/class/net)

Bash(# Check what icon names telegram-desktop uses qdbus | grep -i telegram || gdbus call --session --dest org.freedesktop.DBus --object-path /org/freedesktop/DBus --method org.freedesktop.DBus.ListNames)
Bash(# Get telegram''s StatusNotifierItem IconName gdbus introspect --session --dest org.telegram.desktop --object-path /StatusNotifierItem)
Bash(# Check all StatusNotifierItem services on DBus gdbus call --session --dest org.freedesktop.DBus --object-path /org/freedesktop/DBus --method org.freedesktop.DBus.ListNames)
Bash(# Check if telegram is running pgrep -a telegram)
Bash(# Restart telegram and watch DMS logs pkill telegram-desktop ; sleep 1 telegram-desktop &>/dev/null & sleep 3 journalctl --user -u dms --since ""5 sec ago"")
Bash(# Check if DMS is displaying the icon or showing blank dms ipc call statusline get)
Bash(# Check Papirus-Dark symbolic directory ls /nix/store/*papirus-icon*/share/icons/Papirus-Dark/16x16/symbolic/apps/)
Bash(# Get all recent DMS logs journalctl --user -u dms -n 100)
Bash(# Get all DMS logs from last hour journalctl --user -u dms --since ""1 hour ago"")
Bash(# Restart DMS and watch logs systemctl --user restart dms sleep 3 journalctl --user -u dms --since ""5 sec ago"")

Bash(# Kill and restart telegram, then check registration pkill Telegram sleep 2 # Start telegram in background \(using the user''s preferred way\) nohup telegram-desktop &>/dev/null & sleep 3 journalctl --user -u dms --since ""5 sec ago"")
Bash(# Find the telegram binary which Telegram || find ~/.nix-profile/bin /run/current-system/sw/bin /etc/profiles/per-user/*/bin -name ""*[Tt]elegram*"")
Bash(# Check actual Colloid theme names find /nix/store -maxdepth 1 -name ""*colloid*icon*"" -type d)
